org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl

Class RamDiskAsyncLazyPersistService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.RamDiskAsyncLazyPersistService

  •  class RamDiskAsyncLazyPersistService
extends Object
    This class is a container of multiple thread pools, one for each non-RamDisk volume with a maximum thread count of 1 so that we can schedule async lazy persist operations easily with volume arrival and departure handled. This class and AsyncDiskService are similar. They should be combined.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RamDiskAsyncLazyPersistService

        RamDiskAsyncLazyPersistService(DataNode datanode)
        Create a RamDiskAsyncLazyPersistService with a set of volumes (specified by their root directories). The RamDiskAsyncLazyPersistService uses one ThreadPool per volume to do the async disk operations.

    • Method Detail

      • addExecutorForVolume

        Starts AsyncLazyPersistService for a new volume
        Parameters:
        volume - the root of the new data volume.

      • removeVolume

        void removeVolume(File volume)
        Stops AsyncLazyPersistService for a volume.
        Parameters:
        volume - the root of the volume.

      • queryVolume

        boolean queryVolume(File volume)
        Query if the thread pool exist for the volume
        Parameters:
        volume - the root of a volume
        Returns:
        true if there is one thread pool for the volume false otherwise

      • execute

        void execute(File root,
           Runnable task)
        Execute the task sometime in the future, using ThreadPools.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Gracefully shut down all ThreadPool. Will wait for all lazy persist tasks to finish.
